intro: Dendrochilum gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed tree orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its erect, slender stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests, often as an epiphyte on tree trunks or branches. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in humid environments. The orchid's flowers are usually pale green or yellowish, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by insects.
